# My function

```{r function-prepare_dsm}

#' Obtenir dans le bon format les fichiers nécessaires aux analyses de distance sampling
#'
#' @param map_data dataframe. La carte avec la densité associée
#' @param dist_data dataframe. Les distances entre individus et transects
#' @param segs_data dataframe. Les différents transects utilisés et leur coordonnées
#'
#' @importFrom dplyr select left_join filter mutate
#' @importFrom units drop_units
#' @importFrom sf st_centroid st_coordinates st_drop_geometry
#'
#' @return List. Les différents objects nécessaire pour faire du distance sampling.
#' @export
#'
#' @examples
prepare_dsm <- function(map_data, dist_data, segs_data) {

  obs_dsm <-   left_join(dist_data,segs_data,by='Sample.Label')  %>%
    select(object, Sample.Label, size, distance, detected) %>%
    drop_units() %>%
    filter(detected == 1)

  dist_dsm <-  obs_dsm %>%
    select(object, distance) %>%
    drop_units()

  # segments
  segs_dsm <- segs_data %>%
    st_centroid() %>%
    mutate(X = st_coordinates(.)[,1]) %>%
    mutate(Y = st_coordinates(.)[,2]) %>%
    select(Effort, Sample.Label, X, Y) %>%
    st_drop_geometry() %>%
    drop_units()

  grid_dsm <- map_data %>%
    st_centroid() %>%
    mutate(X = st_coordinates(.)[,1],
           Y = st_coordinates(.)[,2]) %>%
    drop_units() %>%
    as.data.frame() %>%
    select("X","Y","area")

  x <- list(dist_dsm = dist_dsm,
            obs_dsm = obs_dsm,
            segs_dsm = segs_dsm,
            grid_dsm = grid_dsm)

  return(x)

}
```

# Plot dsm

```{r function-plot_dsm}
#' Plot dsm
#'
#' @param dsm_pred_data dsm object. Le modele dsm créé. 
#' @param map_data dataframe. La carte avec la densité associée
#' @param title character. Le titre souhaité pour le graphique
#' @param legend character. La légende souhiatée pour le graphique
#'
#' @importFrom dplyr mutate
#' @importFrom ggplot2 ggplot geom_sf aes coord_sf scale_fill_gradientn labs theme element_text theme_set theme_bw unit
#' @importFrom ggspatial annotation_scale annotation_north_arrow north_arrow_fancy_orienteering
#' @importFrom viridisLite viridis
#' @importFrom sp bbox
#' @importFrom sf as_Spatial
#'
#' @return plot. La zone d'étude avec ce que le modèle a predit.
#' @export 

plot_dsm <- function(dsm_pred_data, map_data, title = "Detection", legend = "Marsouins\n(ind/km2)"){

  dsm_pred_plot  <- map_data %>%
    as.data.frame() %>%
    mutate(density = dsm_pred_data)

  theme_set(theme_bw())

  xlim <- bbox(as_Spatial(map_data))[1, ]
  ylim <- bbox(as_Spatial(map_data))[2, ]

  ggplot() +
    geom_sf(data = dsm_pred_plot$geometry, aes(fill = dsm_pred_plot$density), color = NA) +
    coord_sf(xlim = xlim, ylim = ylim) +
    annotation_scale(location = "br", width_hint = 0.5) +
    annotation_north_arrow(location = "tr",
                           which_north = "true",
                           height = unit(1, "cm"),
                           width = unit(1, "cm"),
                           pad_x = unit(0.2, "cm"),
                           pad_y = unit(0.1, "cm"),
                           style = north_arrow_fancy_orienteering) +
    scale_fill_gradientn(name = legend,
                         colors = viridis(256)) +
    labs(title = title) +
    theme(legend.position = "right",
          legend.key.width = unit(0.5, "cm"),
          plot.title = element_text(lineheight = 0.8, face = "bold"),
          axis.text = element_text(size = 8))
}
```
